title: rna_multisample
description: Processing unimodal multi-sample RNA transcriptomics data.

filter_with_hvg_var_output.description: In which .var slot to store a boolean array corresponding to the highly variable genes.

filter_with_hvg_obs_batch_key.description: If specified, highly-variable genes are selected within each batch separately and merged. This simple
filter_with_hvg_obs_batch_key.help_text:
If specified, highly-variable genes are selected within each batch separately and merged. This simple 
process avoids the selection of batch-specific genes and acts as a lightweight batch correction method. 
For all flavors, genes are first sorted by how many batches they are a HVG. For dispersion-based flavors 
ties are broken by normalized dispersion. If flavor = 'seurat_v3', ties are broken by the median (across
batches) rank based on within-batch normalized variance.

filter_with_hvg_flavor.description: Choose the flavor for identifying highly variable genes. For the dispersion based methods
filter_with_hvg_flavor.help_text:
Choose the flavor for identifying highly variable genes. For the dispersion based methods
in their default workflows, Seurat passes the cutoffs whereas Cell Ranger passes n_top_genes.

filter_with_hvg_n_top_genes.description: Number of highly-variable genes to keep. Mandatory if filter_with_hvg_flavor is set to 'seurat_v3'.

var_qc_metrics.description: Keys to select a boolean (containing only True or False) column from .var.
var_qc_metrics.help_text:
Keys to select a boolean (containing only True or False) column from .var.
For each cell, calculate the proportion of total values for genes which are labeled 'True', 
compared to the total sum of the values for all genes.

top_n_vars.description: Number of top vars to be used to calculate cumulative proportions.
top_n_vars.help_text:
Number of top vars to be used to calculate cumulative proportions.
If not specified, proportions are not calculated. `--top_n_vars 20,50` finds
cumulative proportion to the 20th and 50th most expressed vars.

nextflow input-output arguments.title: Nextflow input-output arguments
nextflow input-output arguments.description: Input/output parameters for Nextflow itself. Please note that both publishDir and publish_dir are supported but at least one has to be configured.

param_list.description: Allows inputting multiple parameter sets to initialise a Nextflow channel. Possible formats are csv, json, yaml, or simply a yaml_blob.
param_list.help_text:
Allows inputting multiple parameter sets to initialise a Nextflow channel. Possible formats are csv, json, yaml, or simply a yaml_blob.
A csv should have column names which correspond to the different arguments of this pipeline.
A json or a yaml file should be a list of maps, each of which has keys corresponding to the arguments of the pipeline.
A yaml blob can also be passed directly as a parameter.
Inside the Nextflow pipeline code, params.params_list can also be used to directly a list of parameter sets.
When passing a csv, json or yaml, relative path names are relativized to the location of the parameter file.

param_list_format.description: Manually specify the param_list_format. Must be one of 'csv', 'json', 'yaml', 'yaml_blob', 'asis' or 'none'.
